duties_responsibilities.duty: Assess the physical and mental condition of patients through comprehensive physical examinations and medical histories.
Order, collect, interpret, and evaluate laboratory and diagnostic tests for patient assessment and healthcare needs.
Prescribe, recommend, or employ medical drug therapies and perform indicated procedures in accordance with approved policies.
Formulate and implement comprehensive patient treatment plans based on assessments, evidence-based medicine, and professional practice guidelines.
Counsel patients and families regarding medical processes, health management, medication, and health promotion.
Maintain appropriate records of patient treatment plans and outcomes.
Provide consultation level services for conditions related to the Provider's specialty and level of training.
Manage patients in healthcare settings other than primary clinic setting.
Perform invasive procedures specific to scope of practice and level of competency.
Follow-up with patients pre- and post-operatively, and may round on patients in the hospital or see patients in the Emergency Department.
Participate in all phases of perioperative patient management including outpatient, inpatient, and operating room settings.
Perform patient care duties beyond regular schedule based on coverage needs of the department.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an Accredited Physician Assistant Program
Current license to practice as a Physician Assistant in the state of Texas
Basic Life Support (BLS) certification within 30 days of hire or transfer
National Commission on Certification of Physician Assistant (NCCPA) certification
